content:
Yes, change is often difficult, especially in the realm of politics and economics, where many stakeholders have different interests and opinions. It is likely that Bernie Sanders' plan to address income inequality would face resistance and challenges, both from within and outside of the government.

However, history shows that major social and economic changes have occurred through sustained efforts and mobilization by ordinary people and their leaders. Bernie Sanders has proven to be a tenacious and popular candidate who has galvanized a large and passionate base of supporters. If he were to become president and had a supportive legislative majority, it is possible that his administration could make significant strides towards addressing income inequality and promoting social and economic justice in the United States.
